title: STEM-Based 2D Shape Design Simulation: Parachute Optimization Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geometry (area, symmetry, ratio calculations) and understanding of physical forces
context.additional_context: Learners utilize BYOD tablets/laptops and perform real-time fall simulations via VR headsets, with an emphasis on team-based problem-solving activities

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively analyze the effects of area and suspension line length on falling speed through experiments with various square parachute designs.
Learners can explain geometric transformations of 2D shapes by implementing rectangles (including rectangles, rhombuses, etc.) of the same area in a VR environment.
Learners can derive optimal parachute designs based on simulation data and write reports connecting them to scientific principles.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
